header_summary:
Antoine Riard highlights the capability of modern compilers like gcc or clang to cross-compile Windows for ARM architecture, emphasizing the significance for bitcoin core developers, particularly regarding the use of x86-specific assembly functions within the secp256k1 library. This discussion underscores the importance of refining the libbitcoinkernel engine and exploring RISC-V support integration, offering insights into the technical intricacies of bitcoin's core codebase and its development ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/e5b06aaa-1fe9-4c8f-a0ea-db10f8a7e48cn@googlegroups.com/T/#mde6e3888f3eb8203b599467c112e91e1f61044e0)).

Moonsettler proposes adding a new opcode, `OP_PAIRCOMMIT`, to tapscript, aiming to enhance rebindable channels and LN-Symmetry without the CAT opcode, focusing on efficiency and optimization in bitcoin scripting capabilities. This proposal, supported by Jeremy Rubin et al., represents a targeted solution for constructing efficient covenant tree or channel factory constructions and is detailed in a GitHub gist and PR: 1699 to the bitcoin/bips repository, inviting further exploration and discussion within the community ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/xyv6XTAFIPmbG1yvB0l2N3c9sWAt6lDTG-xjIbogOZ-lc9RfsFeJ-JPuXuXKzVea8T9TztlCvSrxZOWXKCwogCy9tqa49l3LXjF5K2cLtP4=@protonmail.com/T/#u#m53078da2568e93a70d05c6be71ec0951c3a5786f)).

Jungly introduces Radpool, a novel approach to combat mining centralization by facilitating decentralized block template generation through a syndicate of Mining Service Providers (MSPs). This innovative model, leveraging Discreet Log Contracts (DLCs) for miner payouts, positions Radpool between centralized and peer-to-peer pools, aiming to reduce variance for miners and increase yield opportunities for MSPs, thereby encouraging network expansion and competition. Radpool's design, including the decentralization of block template construction and transparent payment mechanisms, invites community participation and development support ([source](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/radpool-decentralised-mining-pool-with-futures-contracts-for-payouts/1262)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core on ARM (Windows)
recent_posts.summary:
- Compiling Windows on ARM uses gcc or clang without needing a unique toolchain.
- Bitcoin core development faces challenges with x86 assembly in the secp256k1 library.
- RISC-V support integration could significantly advance bitcoin core consensus engine development.

recent_posts.title: OP_PAIRCOMMIT
recent_posts.summary:
- A new opcode `OP_PAIRCOMMIT` is proposed for tapscript to enhance rebindable channels.
- It optimizes LN-Symmetry by reducing SHA256 iterations for efficient unilateral closes.
- The proposal has community support and a reference implementation in the LNhance bitcoin repo.

recent_posts.title: Updates to the Gossip 1.75 proposal post LN summit meeting
recent_posts.summary:
- The unsigned TLV format for SPV proof is appreciated but has raised improvement suggestions.
- Including the outpoint in signed fields could enhance transaction information for `txindex` enabled nodes.
- The eclair team is eager to collaborate on developing features 1 and 2 pending specification readiness.

recent_posts.title: Code of Conduct Violation: Banning Antoine Riard for 3 months

recent_posts.title: Radpool: Decentralised Mining Pool With Futures Contracts For Payouts
recent_posts.summary:
- Radpool aims to decentralize mining by creating a syndicate of Mining Service Providers (MSPs).
- It uses Discreet Log Contracts for miner payouts and promotes decentralization with Free Open Source Software.
- The initiative fosters a balance between centralized and peer-to-peer mining pools, enhancing network growth and stability.

active_posts.title: Signing a Bitcoin Transaction with Lamport Signatures (no changes needed)
active_posts.summary:
- An innovative Lamport signature scheme for Bitcoin transactions was developed without using OP_CAT.
- The method relies on variable ECDSA signature lengths, requiring about 1000 signatures for security.
- While promising, the scheme faces challenges like susceptibility to attacks and is more academic.

active_posts.title: Multi-byte opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- A novel solution proposes multi-byte opcodes to expand Bitcoin's functionality without using NOPs.
- This approach, including a potential OP_OP system, aims to address specific, less common needs.
- Feedback is sought on this sustainable method to enhance opcode functionality, with details on Bitcoin's mailing list.

active_posts.title: CHECKSIGFROMSTACK(VERIFY/ADD)
active_posts.summary:
- Discussions on CHECKSIGFROMSTACK BIP debate its utility and compatibility in Bitcoin scripts.
- Debate includes potential for CSFSA to simplify and make script multisigs more efficient.
- Brandon Black seeks community input to refine these proposals, emphasizing collaboration.

active_posts.title: A Fast, Scalable Protocol For Resolving Lightning Payments
active_posts.summary:
- The OPR protocol enhances Lightning network payments with rapid, size-agnostic resolution methods.
- Innovative features deter dishonest behavior by penalizing fraud, improving security and scalability.
- It promises better scalability and usability, aiming to make the Lightning Network more accessible.

active_posts.title: Channel depletion, LN Topology, Cycles and rational behavior of nodes
active_posts.summary:
- Recent research on the Lightning Network delves into channel depletion via economic and network factors.
- Studies link network fee optimization to channel depletion, using data to predict liquidity distribution.
- Remaining challenges include unknown wealth distributions and the potential for more strategic node operation.

active_posts.title: CTV, APO, CAT activity on signet
active_posts.summary:
- BIPs 118, 119, and 347 introduce major updates to Bitcoin's scripting with signet activation.
- Transactions using `SIGHASH_ANYPREVOUT` mostly involved coinbase payouts, with some using it to bypass `OP_CHECKTEMPLATEVERIFY`.
- `OP_CAT` usage in transactions eclipses that of APO or CTV, indicating widespread application in Bitcoin scripting.
